content.question: A trough is 9 feet long, and its cross section is in the shape of an isosceles right triangle with hypotenuse 2 feet, as shown above. Water begins flowing into the empty trough at the rate of 2 cubic feet per minute. At what rate is the height <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet of the water in the trough changing 2 minutes after the water begins to flow?

choices.label: Decreasing at <math alttext="two thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> foot per minute
Increasing at <math alttext="two thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> foot per minute
Decreasing at <math alttext="one sixth" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> foot per minute
Increasing at <math alttext="one sixth" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> foot per minute

content.answer: Increasing at <math alttext="one sixth" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> foot per minute

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
